alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 25 at 3:59PM CDT until May 27 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL COOK COUNTY... At 358 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Elk Grove Village, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Glenview, Niles and Morton Grove around 405 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Wheeling, Prospect Heights, Buffalo Grove, Northbrook, Winnetka, Northfield, Deerfield and Glencoe. This includes... Oakton Community College. Including the following interstates... I-90 between mile markers 68 and 76. I-94 between mile markers 26 and 34. I-290 between mile markers 1 and 4. I-294 between mile markers 26 and 34. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
